p: In order to determine the inhibitory effects of the essential oils at the early stage of the viral replication, we used a luciferase-based monitoring method using RRV- renLuc and controlled the residual infectivity by plaque assay. The time course of infection of RRV- renLuc (MOI 2) on HEK293T cells was first determined to guide subsequent experiments. We observed that the luciferase activity increases until 36 h post-infection ( Fig 3) while the viral progeny production reaches a maximum at 30 h post-infection ( Fig 3). Thus, the effect of essential oils on RRV- renLuc replication levels was determined 24 h after infection.
